result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Piotrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas M Piotrowski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas M Piotrowski was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: probation currently on in Minnesota

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 1:58 Defendant Thomas M Piotrowski in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CT139 heard at this time. Froelich: guilty to Ct#1, 2 years probation. Dismiss Ct#2 in 15CF211 and 15CT139. Atty Bub and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 15CF211; Bub stipulates to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates guilty to Ct#1. Dismisses Ct#2 in 15CF211 and 15CT139. Froelich addresses sentencing. Bub argues sentencing for 1 year probation. Def addresses court.  Court: S/W 2 years probation on Ct#1 in 15CF211 conditions concurrent to MN probation currently serving. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion Hearing held on February 8, 2016 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR T Carlson

This includes 15CT139   Defendant Thomas M Piotrowski in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motion on the stop and the search.  Deputy Mitch Rhiel is sw and ex by Sean Froelich.  Witness ID's the defendant.  Bub x-exams. Court finds that officer was able to ID the defendant - Motion is denied.  Sean Froelich exams Deputy Rhiel regarding the next motion. Bud x-exams  Exh 1 Google map Exh 2 Photo of pill bottle. Exh # 3 Picture of the pill bottle Exh #1 & 3 are offered and rec.  Terry Turner is sw .  Terry Turner has a pending case and wants to talk to his attorney before testifiying. 3:45 off record for Turner to talk to attorney.  3:57  Court resumes attorneys, defendant are present. Terry Turner is on the stand. Witness Terry Turner takes the 5th. He is excused from the courtroom.  Thomas Piotroswki is sw and ex by Bub. Froelich x-exams. Court finds the stop is justified. Court denies the motion.
Preliminary Hearing held on November 3, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR T Carlson
Def pleas not guilty to charges. court rec/enters. Def to remain until he is handed a notice of hearing. bond to continue and goes over bond conditions with Def.

3:43 Defendant Thomas M Piotrowski in court with attorney Liesl Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CT139 heard at this time. Deputy Mitchell Rhiel swn, etc. ID's Defendant. Record will reflect the indentification of Def. Nelson x ex. Court finds the def probably commited a felony; binds the Def over for trial. Froelich files information. Def has a copy.   Court reads charges and possible penalties. Def waives further reading.

4:23  Defendant Thomas M Piotrowski in court via video conf. with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Thomas M Piotrowski in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of  Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint   Defendant waives reading of the complaint   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.  Defendant waives the time limits for preliminary hearing  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
